Sandberg brings the title to life with a new gimmick It’s a scary version of ‘Groundhog Day’ involving more blood A young woman Clover and her 4 friends go searching for her missing sister Melanie after a family tragedy A gas station attendant directs them to an empty lodge in the woods Unbeknownst to Clover and her friends the horror begins when each of them dies and miraculously come back to life when the night resets itself putting them through a new scenario each time, slowly they realize they’ll keep dying unless they can survive until sunrise But how can they break the chain when they face such terrors as a killer in a mask, an old woman subduing her victims with an oxygen tank, spontaneous combustion or creatures known as Wendigos? I’ll be honest saying I was a bit nervous walking into this one since the fanbase treasures the game so much Of course several changes are expected to happen when you do an adaptation It was a very effective horror movie I gotta say, an entertaining one I got a lot of jolts and enjoyed the gore next to the kills What worried most was the time travel element but they make it fun with the looping from one crazy life or death situation to the next There’s also a ton of exposition at the beginning but they get that out of the way fast Plus there’s a very funny scene in the middle I appreciated that breaks the tension I’m very glad they brought in Peter Stormare, he was a big part of the game and without spoiling too much he wasn’t just a minor cameo in this Sandberg and the filmmakers still stick in minor elements from the original source material like references as well as Easter eggs fans will be able to spot They also do some nice world building as well I only knew one actress Odessa A’zion out of these unknowns; hardly any of them are likable minus the lead herself who’s trying to let go getting past her trauma It’s also a nice touch they break down each scenario as a physical manifestation of a person’s insecurities in a way, fear becomes trauma, our true horrors become what keeps us down, sticking together is how we get through messed up things, what’s more terrifying is not knowing what to expect next, what’s worse is surviving but living without those closest to you This truly felt immersive like you were part of the experience these victims go through The game itself already has a cinematic feel to it like an extended cutscene you can play with your controller so it’s a good thing here they decided to do something different and not be a shot-for-shot recreation After all like a video game if you’re main character dies you have to option to restart and try again so it does have that trait about it Im glad this is a decent adaptation that acts as a love letter to the horror genre that embraces its own nature as far as frights as well as time travel itself
